FacilityName: Americold Logistics Farmer John Distribution Ctr

_prev_prog_3.Description:
AmeriCold Logistics, L.L.C. established a Process Safety Management (PSM) Program at this facility in November 5, 2003.  The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.  These elements and how they satisfy both the PSM and RMP regulations are shown in Table 1.

    TABLE 1  Prevention Program Compliance Matrix

Prevention Program     OSHA PSM Subsection    EPA RMP Subsection
A) Employee Participation    1910.119 ?    40 CFR Part 68.83
B) Process Safety Information    1910.119 (d)    40 CFR Part 68.65
C) Process Hazard Analysis    1910.119 (e)    40 CFR Part 68.67
D) Operating Procedures    1910.119 (f)    40 CFR Part 68.69
E) Training     1910.119 (g)    40 CFR Part 68.71
F) Contractors    1910.119 (h)    40 CFR Part 68.87
G) Pre-Startup Safety Review    1910.119 (i)    40 CFR Part 68.77
H) Mechanical Integrity    1910.119 (j)    40 CFR Part 68.73
I) Hot Work Permit    1910.119 (k)    40 CFR Part 68.85
J) Management of Change    1910.119 (l)    40 CFR Part 68.75
K) Incident Investigation    1910.119 ()     40 CFR Part 68.81
L) Emergency Planning & Response    1910.11l  40 CFR Part 68.
M) Compliance Audits    1910.119m)       40 CFR Part 68.79

The prevention program elements included in Table 1 are detailed in the AmeriCold Logistics, L.L.C. Plant 75190 Fatmer John Distribution Center,Vernon, CA. facility Process Safety Management notebook.  This document is maintained by the Facility Service Manager.  In addition to the Process Safety Management notebook, the Facility Service Manager maintains Piping Diagrams and IIAR safety review forms.  This material includes piping diagrams for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment as well as the International Institute of Ammonia Refrigeration Bulletin 109 safety review forms.  These forms include physical as well as operational data for each piece of ammonia refrigeration equipment. Americold Logistics, LLC establishes a Process Safety Management (PSM) progeam at this facility in November 5, 3003. The PSM program includes all of the RMP Program 3 Prevention Program elements.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
On November 3, 4, & 5, 2003, in preparation for the start-up of the new refrigeration system and because Anhydrous Ammonia (CAS #7664-41-7) will be used as a refrigerant at the Farmer John Distribution Center at 3163 E. Vernon Ave., Vernon, CA 90085, AmeriCold Logistics, LLC implemented the government programs; Process Safety Management (PSM) and Risk Management Planning (RMP). AmeriCold Logistics will manage and operate the facility.

The PSM program was audited for completeness, deficiencies were noted and a program was installed to manage the timely  mitigation of deficiency items and plans to improve safety.  Being that this is a new facility these deficiencies issues were few.  Most consisted of contractor "punch list" Items that will be completed prior to start up.

Upon completion of the PSM, the RMP program was completed.  The RMP team (David Hay, Wayne Isaac, Tom Kelley, and Mike Elliott who are all knowledgeable in the process) found the construction of the facility and the conventional ammonia refrigeration system to be very sound and safe.  The Process Hazard Analysis was found to be in good order.  The 13 elements of the PSM program were reviewed and found to be in good order.  The facility emergency response program and plan was reviewed and found to be in good order.
